I'm running Windows XP.
I followed all the instructions. I installed Python 2.4. Then I 
installed Cantera 1.5.5 - all to default directories that it wanted. 
Then I inserted "C:python24" into system path. The path seems to work 
because I can run python from the windows "command prompt" from any 
directories. But when I try to run python demo files, i.e., flame2.py 
by "Edit with IDLE," (running as in "Run module, F5) I get error 
message below:

IDLE 1.1      ==== No Subprocess ====
>>> 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Documents and Settings\Shock\My Documents\Cantera154
\demos\Python\flame2.py", line 5, in ?
    from Cantera import *
ImportError: No module named Cantera
>>>

This is very frustrating. I even reinstalled cantera. No worky. 
Please help. Somebody.
